intro: Drimys angiensis, commonly known as the Angiense Winter's bark, is a small evergreen tree native to the temperate rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Winteraceae, which is one of the oldest groups of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Drimys angiensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal regions. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported health benefits.
